article.headline: Fordham 95, Fairfield 80
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Marcus Stout scored 18 of his game-high 22 points in the first half to lead Fordham to a 95-80 victory over Fairfield on Wednesday night. Fordham turned a two-point deficit into a commanding lead with a 21-0 run in the first half, and Stout scored 12 of those points. The Rams (3-6) never led by fewer than 15 the rest of the game. Corey McCrae, whose previous season-high was six points, scored 21 with six 3-pointers for Fordham. Bryant Dunston added 16 points and 11 rebounds, and Jermaine Anderson scored 13. Stout added five assists. It was the second straight victory for the Rams, who started 1-6 before winning at Virginia. Michael Bell led Fairfield (1-7) with 17 points and Michael Van Schaick added 16 points and six rebounds. It was the most points Fairfield has allowed at home since a 96-67 loss to Iona in 1999. Fordham shot 48 percent for the game and 54 percent in the first half. It made 11-of-22 from 3-point range and attempted 45 free throws to Fairfield's 13.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
